node.title: PM disappointed government senator reportedly growled at Jacqui Lambie
node.description: Scott Morrison says he was "very, very disappointed" by reports a government senator growled whileÂ Jacqui Lambie spoke during Question Time in parliament yesterday.
node.content:
["Scott Morrison says he was \"very, very disappointed\" by reports a government senator growled while\u00a0Jacqui Lambie spoke during Question Time in parliament yesterday.\u00a0", "Greens senator Sarah Hanson-Young and Labor leader in the Senate Penny Wong both raised points of order, saying a government senator was growling\u00a0during Senator Lambie's question.", "Later on Tuesday afternoon, Coalition senator David Van told the Senate he apologised to Senator Lambie and the Senate \"unreservedly\" for his behaviour, but\u00a0said he did no accept the \"characterisation\" of his interjections.", "\"I commit to holding myself to the highest standards in the future,\" he said.", "On Twitter he also said he did not make \"any kind of animal noise at all\" during his interjection.", "", "
Other senators took issue with someone interjecting while Jacqui Lambie was speaking.(ABC News: Matt Roberts)
", "The Prime Minister said he had not spoken to Senator Van and only learned about what happened last night.", "The accusations against Senator Van came hours after Sex Discrimination Commissioner Kate Jenkins released her report into the workplace culture within parliament.", "It found that one in three people working in parliament experienced some kind of sexual harassment, attributing many of the issues to \"power imbalances, gender inequality and exclusion and a lack of accountability\".", "One of the report's recommendations was to improve the \"everyday respect in the parliamentary chambers\" and specifically called for a review of parliamentary conventions with a view to:", "\"Eliminating\u00a0language, behaviour and practices that are sexist or otherwise exclusionary and discriminatory,\" it said.", "\"[And] improving safety and respect in the parliamentary chambers.\"", "Senator Hanson-Young pointed to the report and its recommendations during Question Time yesterday.", "\"I don't think it's appropriate, given what has been handed down today, to have growling and dog noises coming from this side of the chamber while a female member in this place is on her feet,\" she said.", "\"It is inappropriate and if we're going to change culture from the top then that means all of us.\"\u00a0"]
